title: Force light/white default theme regardless of OS dark mode while preserving pink aesthetic

requirements.summary: Default the site to a light/white theme on first visit (no saved preference), independent of OS color scheme, while preserving existing theme persistence and aesthetics.
acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh visit (no existing theme in localStorage), the homepage background renders as a light/white theme even if the device OS is set to dark mode.
The top-level page background and all main sections (Header, Hero, Categories, Trending, Newsletter, Footer) do not render with a black/near-black background in the default theme.
The theme preference persists as before (if a user explicitly toggles theme, that preference is respected on reload).
No user-facing text is changed away from English as part of this update.

file_operations.description: Change the initial theme selection so that when no theme is stored, the default is 'light' (not 'system'), while preserving existing persistence behavior when a theme value exists in localStorage.

Ensure the initial document renders with a light background by default before React hydration (e.g., set an initial light class on the root element and/or a tiny pre-hydration theme initializer that respects an existing stored preference).

Verify base styles enforce a light background in the default (non-.dark) theme via existing Tailwind theme tokens/CSS variables, and ensure any pre-hydration state still renders a white/light background.

requirements.summary: Audit homepage sections and replace any hard-coded dark/black backgrounds with Tailwind theme tokens so light mode stays consistently white with pink accents.
acceptanceCriteria: A code search finds no use of hard-coded black/dark background utility classes (e.g., bg-black, bg-zinc-900, bg-neutral-950) in the homepage components that would affect the default (light) appearance.
Light mode backgrounds across the homepage visually read as white with soft pink accents, consistent with the existing CSS variable theme tokens.

file_operations.description: Confirm the top-level wrapper uses theme tokens for background (e.g., bg-background) and adjust if any non-token/dark background styling is present so the default (light) appearance is consistently white.
Audit for any hard-coded dark/black backgrounds and ensure the header surface uses Tailwind theme tokens (bg-background/bg-card/muted variants) in light mode rather than dark color utilities.

Audit hero gradients/overlays for any hard-coded dark/black backgrounds and ensure overlays/surfaces use Tailwind theme tokens (bg-background, muted variants) to keep light mode white with soft pink accents.
Audit category card background utilities to ensure light mode uses light token-aligned surfaces (or light pink gradients) and does not rely on hard-coded dark/black background classes.

Audit the section background and card/media container backgrounds to ensure they are derived from Tailwind theme tokens (bg-background/bg-muted/bg-card) rather than hard-coded dark/black utilities that could impact light mode.
Audit newsletter panel backgrounds/borders to ensure they remain light in default theme and rely on Tailwind theme tokens/soft pink accents instead of any hard-coded dark/black background utilities.
Audit footer background and dividers to ensure they use Tailwind theme tokens (bg-muted/bg-background and border tokens) and remove/replace any hard-coded dark/black background utilities if present.
